statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Creighton 79, Drake 56
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- Anthony Tolliver scored 18 points and blocked five shots and Nick Bahe made five 3-pointers while scoring a career-high 15, leading Creighton to a 79-56 victory over Drake on Tuesday night. Creighton (10-5, 4-1 Missouri Valley Conference) improved to 7-0 at home and beat Drake (9-7, 0-5) for the eighth time in nine meetings. Dane Watts added 13 points, Nate Funk 12 and Nick Porter 10 for the Bluejays, who shot a season-high 65.9 percent. Nick Grant and Jonathan Cox had 11 points apiece and Al Stewart nine to lead the Bulldogs, who shot 32.8 percent. Drake's Ajay Calvin, who came in as the Valley's No. 2 scorer at 17.7 points a game, was held to seven. The Bluejays, who led 32-31 at half, opened the second half on a 10-2 run fueled by back-to-back 3s by Funk and Watts. After Drake pulled to 44-38, Creighton scored 10 straight points to build a 16-point cushion. The Bluejays were up by 20 or more by the final three minutes. Creighton made nine of its first 12 shots while breaking out to a quick double-digit lead. But the Bulldogs were up 31-30 in the final minute of the first half after a 15-1 run. Creighton went the final 8:06 of the half without a field goal, but got two free throws from Funk to lead by a point at the break. The crowd of 16,315 was the largest to see a basketball game in Nebraska.
